el mariachi released in 1993 was
legendary filmmaker robert rodriguez's
directorial debut it featured a
predominantly amateur cast and was
filmed in various locations around the
city of acuna located in the mexican
state of kuahila now it's the story of a
traveling guitar player with a modest
desire to play music for a living but
when he stops at a bar in a tiny town
his simple life is interrupted by local
hitmen who mistake him for an enemy
assassin
now you're probably more familiar with
the sequel films and rodriguez's mexico
trilogy desperado and once upon a time
in mexico and that's because they
featured an a-list cast and had a hefty
budget to work with but el mariachi the
one that started it all was made on a
shoestring budget of just over seven
thousand dollars and thonces
you must be the mariachi who came into
my town
killed my men
and ran off with my virgin

roma is set in mexico city in the 1970s
and follows live in housekeeper gleo one
of the two domestic workers who help
antonio and sophia an upper middle class
couple take care of their four children
now complications soon arise when
antonio runs away with his mistress and
cleo finds out that she's pregnant not
cool antonio sophia decides to take a
vacation with the kids and invites cleo
along for a much needed getaway to clear
her mind and bond with the family and
the film gets its name for being set in
the colonia roma neighborhood which is
where writer director alfonso cuaron
grew up in fact juaron has admitted that
roma was as autobiographical as it can
be adding that 90 comes out of his
memory and they actually shot in the
places where the scenes took place
plus he gathered most of the original
furniture in his home from different
family members all around mexico and
cast actors that looked as much as
possible like the original people
oh
poured his heart and soul into this
deeply personal feature and it paid off
because roma was one of the most
critically acclaimed films of the decade
the new yorker wrote that quote it is
the clarity of guadal's eye and the sea
like sway of his remembrance that compel
you to trust the tale that he tells
and touching on the film seems the
washington post wrote that roma achieves
a rare feat of making the personal
authentically political not through
explicit polemic or tortured metaphors
but simply by observing life with enough
perspective to reflect in it all its
contradictions additionally roma was
nominated for 10 oscars at the 91st
academy awards winning for best director
best cinematography and best foreign
language film this is the first mexican

and one of his pinnacle works is the

set in 1944 spain it's the story of a
young girl named ophelia who arrives at
the army post of her ailing mother's new
husband captain vidal navidal is a
phalange officer deranged psychopathic
and desperately trying to thwart off a
spanish maquis uprising now while

dangerous tasks in order to claim
immortality now del toro considers this
story a parable and the film perfectly
intertwines dispiriting historical
events with fairy tale elements the
mundane with the magic

the film explores complex scenes like

film with the highest possible rating 18
plus alfonso and his brother were so

scene hombre
[Music]
is a 2009 mexican american thriller
written and directed by kyrie joji
fukunaga it follows saida a honduran
teen who longs for a better life that
opportunity presents itself when she's
reunited with her strange father who
intends to immigrate to mexico and then
enter the united states cyrus life then
collides with a pair of mexican gang
members who have boarded the same
american bound train sin nombre was
fukunaga's feature-length debut but it's
similar to a short film that he had
directed while attending nyu entitled
victoria parachino that short film was
based on a real incident that took place
in victoria texas where a truckload of
passengers who were immigrating to the
united states died of heat exhaustion
after being abandoned by their driver
fukunaga had written an article about
this tragedy which inspired him to make
the short film and that film's success
put him on the map and gave him the
boost that he needed to then make sin
nombre which translates to without a
name
right out of the gate fukunaga proved to
be a visionary with a passion for human
rights and scene nombre was met with
rave reviews the washington post called
it quote pure filmmaking and a great
story told in beautiful images and the
associated press wrote that si nombre is
at once subtle and intense familiar but
refreshing intimate even as it tells the
story untold numbers have endured
most importantly fukunaga has given a
name a face and a story to a demographic
that deserves to be represented

who is in the middle of a creative
crisis and revisits memorable events of
his past in addition to banderas the
